Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, price in what is now a very expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: Jen_MAR1976
Reviews.Content: As an Australian based in London I am constantly travelling back and forward visiting family. I choose to stay in this hotel over all of the others, including the high end luxury chains simply because it offers a superb service which the other hotels donâ€™t seem to have these days, regardless of star rating! On the few occasions I needed to speak to reception staff (about transport options and advice) they were very helpful. I actually went down at a peak time and although they were extremely busy checking people in and out, they gave every guest a personal and patient approach efficiently offering all they could do to help or assist- this included juggling a restaurant reservation, calling/hailing taxiâ€™s, even going out to retrieve luggage for arriving guests in the pouring rain before they even got out of the car! Although very busy, their ingenuity was not compromised. The three staff on duty not once batted an eyelid or huffed/puffed, they were truly lovely. The free wifi worked in the room so no complaints there, obviously in peak times it was a little slow. The room itself was spotlessly clean, linen included. The bathroom granted is no spa, however pristine and the shower itself large enough for two!.. plenty of fresh towels. No window in the bathroom, although a powerful and working air vent. The room is plain, basic, no decorative trimmings, although spacious enough for two people. Each bed (Twin room) had itâ€™s own reading light, as did the desk and of course reverse cycle air conditioning worked a treat on the hot days! No room service is offered, there is tea/coffee making facilities in the room also plenty of chic cafes/restaurants within a short walking distance (who offer take away!). It is a perfect location for Sydney because it is in equal distance to Bondi Beach or the CBD - you have the best of both worlds. $10 taxi ride to each (depending on traffic). Busses in either direction leave literally just outside the front door. There are plenty of pubs/bars/restaurants plus designer boutiques, book shops within walking distance, including the markets on a Saturday. The pool/garden area is very pleasant, quiet, relaxing place to sit in the cooler evenings. The rooms facing the garden were vey quiet too and as a light sleeper especially in a big city I appreciated this! As I left my room housekeeping arrived in the hallway, and although I had a â€˜no entryâ€™ sign on my door handle the Japanese man was very smiley and accommodating asking me as I left if I needed anything extra like towels or did I need the bins emptied. All in all a great little five star service in the heart of what is now a very expensive city .. I have already booked another 7night stay for June!

Reviews.Title: “Staying the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: calJCS
Reviews.Content: Lovely Paddington hotel walk to Surety Hills restaurants, catch buss across street to Bonding beach, quick bus ride to ferry for Manly beach. Very walkable, pleasant environment. Our room was comfortable, interesting shape. We got garden room at higher price for in room wifi that never worked during our stay (boo) I recommend paying lower price get room facing the laneway +for quiet). Sydney is expensive, but I think this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Small box, wheres the art?”
Reviews.Author: brendanmeilak
Reviews.Content: You know you've stepped back into the 80s, but someone has tried to hide it with a few modern pieces in the foyer, but when you hit the room and the bed spread is pink floral. The rooms were clean, but oh so small, and the Oxford Street aspect was well on boring side. I really felt like I'd paid for a hotel, but was staying in a flash-packers! Two people, a mardi-gras weekend in a twin room - we were never bound to spend too much time in the room. The balcony doors had not even been finished, you could see bare wood between the two doors - very shabby. On day two I went for the included breakfast, which was a Continental Buffet, it was nice, till they tried to charge me for it on checkout. Staff gruffly solved the hiccup. Look if you get a good rate and are in Sydney, then this is the place for you, but I thought it was over priced for the product on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cubist is not my thing”
Reviews.Author: marigold g
Reviews.Content: Great staff, modern furnishings, close to everything however cubist is not my thing. Small.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely dining experience”
Reviews.Author: shehanwije
Reviews.Content: Had a casual dinner in the upstairs restaurant with 2 others. Super atmosphere, attentive service and well presented tasty dishes. Highly recommend dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, pleasant, simple”
Reviews.Author: inlyon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no problems. Not romantic, not exceptional but right on. The staff was friendly and helpful, the WiFi was free and good quality. Everything worked. Breakfast was $AU15 but that is not bad in Sydney. It had all the fresh fruit we could eat, bottomless coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful staff, warm welcome and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Hovelucy
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel as a stopover on our way from London to Melbourne. Arriving at an unearthly hour on a Sunday morning off a long haul flight, our room was ready and the staff were welcoming and incredibly helpful. Located on a main bus route into CBD and all the main Sydney sites, right on the city sightseeing bus route and in the middle of Paddingtons lovely shops and cafes, it was a perfect location. Breakfast was substantial and they also offered a discount on an evening meal in the next door pub which was really tasty and good value. Lovely looking little pool and seating area which we never got to use but would be great on a hot day. Great value for money and definitely worth a visit. Lucy, England

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: clivemc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights as part of a round the world trip. We had a garden room that was a free upgrade, we had'nt asked for it but was offered by Marc the manager. Room had free wi-fi, air con, iron, coffee/tea making facilities, safe, flat screen T.V, fridge and was neat, clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic, nice safe area, lovely little cafes and nice places to eat. Bus stops 100 yards away and Sydney Harbour is 10 minutes by bus or a 25 minute walk away. If you are into the beach Bondie is a 15 minute bus ride in the opposite direction. There are some lovely shops in the area that are very chic and trendy, very up market and very expensive but great to window shop. Dont miss the arts and craft market every Saturday, loads of hand made items,photo's and paintings etc. We enjoyed a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and useful stop over.”
Reviews.Author: Laker70
Reviews.Content: We had booked on line for a one night stop over when returning to the UK from New Zealand. The room was indeed small though the bathroom was a fair size. Everything was scrupulously clean and the bed was very comfortable. Reception staff were excellent and went out of their way to help when our airport shuttle failed to turn up on time. We did not eat in the restaurant but explored the very interesting surroundings of Paddington finding really good coffee bars in bookshops for breakfast. We met up with friends who took us to an excellent Vietnamese Restaurant. The vicinity has very interesting fashion shops but luckily baggage allowances avoided bankruptcy.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel in covenient location”
Reviews.Author: RobbieIlaria
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 week in July and then 1 night only in September. The rooms are small but the bed is comfy. If you take a room on Oxford st it could be a little noise but they have triple glass windows. TV and internet access (the latter in the garden facing rooms only). You also get a 10% discount in the next door restaurant/pub. I tried it and it was decent (not wow, though). The area is nice, a lot of restaurants and cafes, a cinema next door, nice shops. Definitely worth if you are looking for a basic - yet clean-room. Garden facing much better than Oxford st facing.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Evabluebell
Reviews.Content: stayed here for almost a week while renovating. Was fine. Internet worked well for first 2 days, but then stopped. Room serivce was hit and miss. Some days sheets replaced on bed, other days we found ourself with just a doona and a bottom sheet which was odd. Towels very thin and old. No free breakfast, but there were apples and small muffins available at the front desk for guests. Parking was avilable also. it is certainly not a place for a romatic getaway, but does the job fine if you just need a room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A little below nothing special”
Reviews.Author: travel6345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on reviews on here and price. Sydney is quite expensive so I thought I'd try this place. My room was a little small and kind of hot. When you leave the room, the air conditioner turns off and so in the summer in February it was very stuffy when I'd return. The location is not far from all of the major attractions downtown. I walked everywhere. Although its uphill so a walk back is harder than the walk there. However, this is more a by product of Sydney itself not being terribly large and not the direct area of Paddington itself. I stayed here about 4 nights and never really found a decent breakfast place nearby. I usually ended up going to The Rocks to eat dinner. The Arts is in the center of the gay district for Sydney, think Castro Street (San Francisco) which is okay, but some of the shops were a bit much and the pubs which I was excited about being located nearby from what I could tell were all gay as well. For a budget area, I'd look at Kings Cross or Potts Point. Australia was a very safe place, and I had no problem walking around Sydney alone at night and saw several young women doing the same. The WiFi worked a little bit in my room, but wasn't terribly fast. Staff seemed okay. Overall, it worked but I'd be happy to try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Quirky Hotel lives up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: Angellous
Reviews.Content: We had very good service at this hotel the staff very helpful, the room and all around had lots of original art works on the wall it is close to the Art School. They give a discount card for the pub next door which serves excellent food, they have a breakfast buffet which is good value

Reviews.Title: “Location is good but hotel is in dire need of a facelift and I couldn't find any trace of "Art"”
Reviews.Author: tazmaniak
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by this hotel. I was hoping that previous reviewers were exaggerating the mould/smell problem but it really does exist. I asked to be moved as it was overpowering but the hotel was full. My first impression was an Irish backpacker laying on the hall floor surfing the Internet as he couldn't get a signal in his room and took most of his mobile calls in the hall so as not to disturb his girlfriend. This wasn't hotel's fault but it was an omen for the stay. Beds are decorated with circa 1980s polyester bedspreads, and cheap office furniture, bathrooms are really, really tiny and I had to leave fan on all night to try and get smell of mould out. Internet was promised but signal was so weak in my room, I ended u using my 3G on mobile. management didn't fix this problem during my stay. Breakfast was OK and the lovely Asian lady in the breakfast room was the absolute nicest person at the entire hotel. Staff can be disinterested and borderline rude and aren't a good example of Australian service (there was a receptionist with a seemingly French accent who had a distinctly Parisian attitude). Hotel was very expensive like most Sydney hotels but this one could do with a million dollar refit before I'd return. More like a Motel than an "Art Hotel" (would love an explanation of the name of this joint)

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character, great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: psinner
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay - interesting slightly 'bohemian' part of town. The hotel has a lovely courtyard to sit outside in, friendly, informal and helpful staff. Nice fresh breakfast buffet. Overall if you want a different experience from the bog standard corporate hotel this is it. Also a good restaurant/bar right next door. One small negative would be that the rooms need re-decorating but overall a very enjoyable stay, rooms also very quiet made for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but staff exceptional & location great”
Reviews.Author: Pen1e
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on mainly excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and because the price, for Sydney, even with dreadful current exchange rate to Â£, is good. Our room was a reasonable size, good choice of TV channels, good lighting, excellent bed linen and comfortable beds. Cramped shower room, shower fixed so water splashes everywhere, no air extractor so always wet & damp. Useless hair drier fixed to the wall beside the basin. Soap dispenser only (shampoo available if you ask at reception). Only two small towels provided for 2 people. More available if you ask. Good hanging/storage space, tea/coffee making facilities. Window that opens. Aircon. Room not cleaned well and smelt unclean when we booked in. Complained about this & received fulsome apology & free breakfasts. But the room smelt the same every day. Inadequate ventilation from drains/shower room I think. The cafe is only open for breakfast (which was OK - good value). You get a 10% voucher off meals/drinks at the pub next door. The staff at Arts Hotel were very helpful and efficient. Also there is free internet access via a PC in reception for guests, the location is excellent. The pool & patio area are great.

Reviews.Title: “What a location”
Reviews.Author: roslen1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arts Hotel - beautiful art on the wall in the breakfast room. Great location, great price, great value and great staff. Would recommend this as the place to stay when in Paddington or Woollahra - walking distance to everything - fox studios, sports grounds, moore park, golfing, cinemas, bookshops - fantastic afer a day of work - fantastic anytime

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: oldboltonian
Reviews.Content: We got two interconnecting rooms at the back of the hotel (rooms at the front give onto the permanently busy Oxford St.). The building and rooms are not new any more, but clean and well maintained. Breakfast was good. Service was excellent, all staff very helpful and proactive in recommending what to do and the best way to do it. This hotel seemed one of the best value for money in Sydney. Free wireless internet was an unexpected (and alas in Australia, unusual) bonus. The buses to Circular Quay run very frequently from almost outside the front door of the hotel. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. In winter the rooms can get chilly, so make sure you understand how to control the AC before going to bed!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireLady
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many hotels we chose thishotel based on the mostly positive reviews on this site however we were disappointed with the hotel, even though our expectations were set for a budget hotel. Our room was small and outdated. The tiny ensuite had no ventilation so the bathroom was constantly damp. The hotel left the bedroom window open to 'fix' the problem which might be acceptable in summer but when it's cold and damp outside the room becames very cold and uncomfortable. At times we were very cold despite trying to get the room heated. Another traveller in our party had a better room so I suspect your experience of the hotel will vary according to the room you have been allocated. We had the choice to stay in the hotel on the return leg of our trip but chose not too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, good enough room”
Reviews.Author: Hen1973
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at The Arts Hotel, Paddington, for two nights (Thursday and Friday) at the end of July 2010. LOCATION: The location of the hotel is excellent ... easy walking distance to the boutique shops and cafes along Oxford Street; easy walking distance to the City, Queen Victoria Building, and Pitt Street Mall (for the shoppers); easy walking distance to restaurants ranging from Mediterranean tapas to Greek; easy walking distance to pubs and clubs; and almost next door is an arthouse cinema. If not fond of walking, bus stops are located just outside the hotel on Oxford Street. ROOM: My best friend and I stayed in room 319. The room was located on level 3 (of 3 levels) at the rear of the hotel. Although the room was small, I did not think it was too small. It had two single beds, a good sized cupboard with mirrored sliding doors, a shelf large enough for one medium suitcase, a desk with chair, air conditioning, a large window with sheer and solid curtains (that cut out the light), a wall-mounted television that had free-to-air channels and some Austar channels. The bathroom contained a toilet, shower, wall-mounted hair dryer, mirror and basin. The bathroom was small (one person could use the basin at a time). Wall-mounted liquid soap and toilet paper provided however other items such as mini shampoos, moisturisers, etc not provided. CAR PARKING: There aren't too many hotel/motels in Sydney that provide free car parking so this is a great perk ... The Arts offers free secure parking within the hotel. There are approximately 10 spaces within the car park. LAUNDRY: A laundry is located off the car park. I did not use the laundry however I assume that it is coin operated. STAFF: During our staff we dealt with two staff. Both were very friendly and helpful. NOISE: I thought that a hotel on Oxford Street would be extremely noisy due to traffic and neighbouring pubs, etc, however at no time did I hear noise from traffic or persons. CLEANLINESS: The hotel and room were very clean. SECURITY: At a certain time during the evening, the front door of the hotel is locked and entry can only be gained by reception staff (reception operates 24 hours a day). STAIRS v ELEVATOR: The hotel has stairs and an elevator. MEALS: My friend had breakfast at the hotel which looked nice (yoghurt, fruit, muesli). I am not sure if the hotel provides other meals and it does not provide room service. POOL: Sign to pool however I didn't look at it. FACIALS AND THAT GOOD STUFF: Aveda Day Spa is only a few spots down the road. I would definitely stay at The Arts again.

Reviews.Title: “shabby not chic”
Reviews.Author: pommycousin
Reviews.Content: Rooms small and poorly furnished with "bedsit" type furniture. Staff civil but not welcoming. One day our room wasn't cleaned until after 2pm even though we had vacated it at around 9.30 am. We had previously stayed in the Sydney Harbour Youth Hostel and wished we had returned there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: safferinlpl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arts in May 2010. The location is brilliant, short walk into city. Bus stop is 2 minutes walk away. Oxford Street is busy, and has plenty of choice for eating. Staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: RT111
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Arts Hotel via TripAdvisor and travelled 3000km across Australia to arrive at 8am. We went to the wrong address - there are two, possibly three 21 Oxford Street addresses. Our first choice was sleazy and wrong. So we caught a short cabride to trendy Paddington, East Sydney and Ali at reception was terrific and we occupied our rouble room immediately. Our room was not huge, but we had a window overlooking an enclosed garden with pool, fountain and mural. It's a short bus ride west into Sydney CBD, or east to Bondi Beach. There are lots of art galleries and restaurants in the Paddington neighbourhood. A very happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “BEDS ARE BEST”
Reviews.Author: mamalou69
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful, great place to stay for footy at aussie stadium and the beds are comfy as:) located right on Oxford st everything is within walking distance that you need to have a lovely time. Buses depart regularly to take you into the city and you are a short walk from Paddington markets and the local restuarantsand pubs are great. We had ajoining rooms and felt safe. my partner now stays there for business and it is perfect for him too

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DoveIpswich
Reviews.Content: The Arts hotel is in a great area, perfect for a bus or walk into town, with lots of trendy shops and bars. The reception staff were bright, cheerful and always helpful, they even gave us an old blanket to sit on while we waited for the New Year fireworks down at the harbour. I think the hotel is going through an upgrade at the moment and ours was still waiting, although it was a bit tired it was always clean and comfortable. Free internet was good. Used the discount card for food next door, good basic food, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in handy location”
Reviews.Author: JAK45
Reviews.Content: The Arts Hotel is located in a really good area of town for browsing around the local shops and streets. It is well maintained and the bathroom of the was recently refurbished with all amenities in compact but sufficient space. The staff were extremely helpful and obliging (and fluent in French) making a relaxing time. The next door pub with discount makes for good value non-gastronomic food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1232
Reviews.Content: The Arts hotel is located in the Paddington area of Sydney. This is an "Artsy" and very liberal section of town that is also on the upper part of Oxford street. The staff were very kind and helpful. The room was a good value (Sydney can be expensive) and we always felt comfortable there. The little garden area is a nice place to relax. There is also internet in the hotel, but I believe you need to access the wireless in the garden area or have a room close to it (and it's free). There is a pub/restaurant that they own, which is out the front door to the right. The food is reasonable and amazing. Lots of locals eat and drink there and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Generally a Rugby game playing on the T.V., and it's a friendly, safe place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Informative Staff”
Reviews.Author: NikJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Christmas Eve through to New Years Day with my wife and 5yr old son. Nice location in the trendy Paddington - walk towards the CBD, you get the Paddington nightlife, walk in the other direction, there are the trendy boutique shops & lovely old houses, and trendy restaurants - Arts Hotel is in a great location - buses run into the CBD every 5-10mins, and in the other dorection towards Bondi. Had a family room (3 bed), which was a bit of a squeeze, though it was at the end of the corridor, and quiet, and in the central courtyard- we were not affected by noise in any way. Rooms were a bit "tired", though comfortable and equipped with fridge and kettle etc. Staff are very helpful from when you arrive to departure - not a poor word to say anything about them. Great praise to Ali for all his assistance every morning. Free Wireless access from the rooms, which was an excellent bonus. Small pool for a quick swim and courtyard areas were used effectively. Discount for the pub next door, which was good value (as previous postings indicate). Has washing/drying facilities, bikes to use, as well as off-street parking. We used the weekly bus/train/ferry weekly pass, which was about $48 for the week (adult) Selected this hotel on the basis of a friends recommendation and though did have to pay a premium for the time around Christmas/New Year, though compared with other hotels, this was a gem of a bargain...

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazza1900
Reviews.Content: Arrived late after long flight and were checked in quickly. Room somewhat dated but very comfortable and the free wifi was a definite bonus. Hotel has pool which we didn't use. Used bar next door for snack with discount given by hotel - good grub. Bus stop into town outside hotel door ask about prepaid tickets Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great , friendly service and good location”
Reviews.Author: Bob+Diane
Reviews.Content: Sullivans (now The Arts Hotel) is great! Whilst it is only relatively basic the staff are genuine and so helpful, the small pool is great to relax between adventures and the location is great! The room we had was quiet, bright with a comfortable and big bed and we slept like logs! Breakfast buffet was included in our rate and was good, decent choice. Location great for wondering around Paddington and on the day we arrived we breakfasted at Bill's which was lovely. It was also handy to catch local bus to Bondi beach which was nicer than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but....”
Reviews.Author: glasskate
Reviews.Content: this was a repeat visit for us, stayed there 2 years ago. our room was quite small, bedspread and furniture tired looking, bathroom had mold in shower. if you want soap, shampoo, etc. you must buy it from the reception desk. on the plus side, the location is great ! Paddington is a fashionable neighborhood with many nice restaurants, coffee shops and stores. On saturdays, the Paddington Market should not be missed. Oxford street has the bus line to Circular Quay, Central Station and Bondi Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: Jahee
Reviews.Content: First off the location is excellent, its about 1 or 2 blocks up from Taylors square on oxford street. We booked a standard queen room and it met our needs fine as we were only there for a night out in sydney. The room is cosy but you cant really have guests over in the room because it is too squishy but there is a cute courtyard where me and a couple of friends has a few drinks before heading out and that was perfect. One strange thing i found is that your required to leave your key at reception when you leave the premises. I didnt mind too much because then i couldnt loose it! Also, make sure if your driving you get there early because there is only maybe 10-15 parking spaces and if the parking get filled then you have to make your own arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_Houle
Reviews.Content: I went to Australia with my boyfriend in March. We stayed in Sullivans Hotel for 3 nights. The room was clean. It wasn't that big but since we were there only to sleep, it was perfect for us. I've never see staff so pleasant and helpful. They were always smiling, always offering help. They were very very nice. Breakfast is not included in the price, but I think it's around 10-15AUD per person and it's a great buffet. The hotel is located about 20 minutes walk from downtown but there is also a bus stop right on the street next to the hotel. You must ask for a quiet room because it is situated on a big boulevard. There is an Internet station free for the guests. Sullivans Hotel is a must if you go to Sydney and you don't want to pay too much and have a great value for your moeny. I recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: pussNewZealand
Reviews.Content: If you want a 5 star room this is not for you, but if you want 5 star staff and location then it most certainly is!This hotel offers great value for money and I highly recommend it, particularly for more mature couples. This was a second trip for my wife and I and we were treated like one of the family Many thanks team

Reviews.Title: “great location, but room was showing its age”
Reviews.Author: travelguydc
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night in march 2009. location was great -- right on oxford street in paddington, and a few blocks from darlinghurst. service was helpful and friendly. they even upgraded me from a front-room to a courtyard room. i've got to say, though, based on all the glowing reports i read here and in tour books, i was surprised to find the room to be pretty faded. furniture was modest and dated (though it was clean). room was small (bathroom was tiny -- must have been a converted closet). Nice flat screen tv though. hotel location is great, and it's definitely a place with character. if you want to stay in the oxford street area, Sullivans seems like one end of the spectrum, with the corporate/soulless-but-fully-equipped Marriott, up at the other end of Oxford St on Hyde Park, at the other end of the spectrum.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would go back again anytime”
Reviews.Author: welshmechanic
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, very friendly staff. Location is fine, not too far from centre of Sydney and if your feeling lazy the bus stops almost outside. Ask at reception, can also get bus to Bondi across road.

Reviews.Title: “Sullivans is secure, friendly and on the spot”
Reviews.Author: longbich
Reviews.Content: The main point for us was locational convenience. It's across Oxford Street and down towards Taylor's Square about 75 metres from St Vincents Hospital. The staff were efficient and kind, allowed us to leave the car there the next day which is a huge bonus in Sydney where parking is like hen's teeth and if you can find it is very expensive. There are heaps of restaurants and bars along Oxford Street. Beware if you are homophobic 'cause it is a focal place for the gay scene along this strip. It's right next door to The Rose Crown & Thistle pub, known as the 3 weeds which has good tucker and plenty of beers on tap. It also has a very good deal for lunch time wine/meals. Victoria Barracks is almost next door and of course Taylor's Square is just a couple of blocks away. There is no train station. Plenty of buses, the 389, goes from downtown up Oxford Street to Bondi.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent”
Reviews.Author: STEVIEBHampshire
Reviews.Content: Booked in on second part of Oz experience.Ideally located near city and beaches no more than 30 minutes by bus.Staff were very helpful and had free use of internet.Breakfast was very good although no bar in hotel.Rooms tidy and clean although very small balcony ,enough room for one small person.Very close to many bars and good restaurants.Pool area although was neglected and in need of some repair.Overall very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Robbo23
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Great base for exploring Sydney, surrounded by great shops (an Ed Hardy store opposite!) and the bus stop to Sydney harbour 30 seconds down the road. Rooms are nothing spectacular but are more than adequate. They're clean, tidy, comfortable, very quiet - even on the street facing rooms which have about 3 sliding doors and THICK curtains to avoid any traffice noise. The staff were amazing, very knowledgeable and happy to show you how to get to places on maps (which they let you have). I had a medical issue whilst I was there and the chap on reception phoned the nearest doctor surgery (on xmas eve) and asked if they could take a brit, how much it was and what were their opening times. He really did put himself out to help, for which I will always be extremely greatful! Would definately stay again and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: peleer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night, but I was most impressed by the location, staff and room. The room was basic, but had everything you could need, including safe and refrigerator. Free internet access is available in the lobby. Next time I'm in Sydney, I'll definitely return to Sullivans.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: OliveNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time we have stayed here, it's still one of the best places to stay in Sydney...always nice to find that things haven't changed (for the worst) The front desk staff made us feel very welcome and as returning guests they even upgraded our room ( which considering we booked through a last minute booking agency was generous) The back part of the hotel is definitely the quietest, also we like the fact that we can hear the birds in neighboring houses in the morning. It is so easy to reach the centre of the city from here that I cannot imagine why anyone would want to stay any closer. We love the walks around the area, and esp going down the hill to the Liverpool st Bill's Cafe (Bill Granger) for brekky. One really nice touch is that the hotel provides guests with a good overview of things to do places to eat in the room info file, this is a great touch and much appreciated. Try dinner at Fish Face!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Had a Better Stay”
Reviews.Author: intrepidfox7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Sullivans in Sydney for nine days and I would have to say it was the most enjoyable stay we have had at any hotel for quite some time. The location in Paddington is excellent. Buses come by frequently both east to the lovely beaches or west to downtown and points outward. Lovely coffee shop across the way, excellent bookstore right by the hotel and a Irish pub a short walk east. Most of all, though, the staff are excellent. The two main fellows at the desk downstairs were like personal friends to us over the course of our stay. They recommended weekly bus passes which saved us lots of money on travel and were always very helpful with directions and bus routes. Rooms at the hotel are cosy. I have to also add I never heard any noise from the hallways or from the floor above, which is always nice when one wants to get some rest. Did not do the pool or rent the bikes but they are available at no extra cost. One computer with free internet and that was usually available so no need to visit an internet cafe (nice to save a bit there as well). Loved staying at Sullivans and could not more highly recommend the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Shortstayspecialist
Reviews.Content: I feel a bit mean only giving it a 2 rating but i was quite disappointed. We had a room on the side of the building, across the street from some houses. A typical set up for a city hotel I am sure. The room was...small. It was pretty well impossible not to trip over your bag on the way to the miniscule bathroom. You wouldn't want to be clostrophobic! The bed was fairly comfortable but the pillows were ROCK hard. Bring your own shampoo, etc. as there are NO bathroom complimentaries. Only one towel per person and no floor matt. There is a tea/coffee service but no raw sugar. Later that night as the cold settled in I went downstairs to ask for another blanket. The staff were amused at my request . The look they gave each other seemed to say "we're not one of those kinds of hotels". I was instead instructed to use the air conditioning which was ridiculous as I wouldn't like to sleep with it on all night. We piled our winter coats on the bed for warmth instead. The 'sleeping' part of the hotel is attached to the original Sullivans Hotel (pub section). We went there for dinner and were VERY HAPPY! The service was absolutely fantastic, the food was fresh and tasty AND reasonably priced (we had the bean nachos and the salt and pepper squid which came with a yummy salad). One thing that MUST be said about the Sullivans hotel is that it is in an EXCELLENT location. You can't beat it for the price (though not cheap, fairly cheap for Sydney). The rooms are clean and it is great not to have to share a bathroom. Go to the Sullivans hotel for dinner and a beer and a city-sleep ;)

Reviews.Title: “Bit Disappointed.....”
Reviews.Author: tulip
Reviews.Content: Feel a bit mean only giving it a 2 rating but i was quite disappointed. We had 2 room on the side of the building, maybe if we'd had one of the internal rooms overlooking the garden it may have been better. The rooms we had looked very tired. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was spotless but the windows looked old and the curtains were really shabby. the nets were gray and in one room there was a horrible yellow stain on them. There's really no excuse for that, it doesnt cost a lot to put clean nets up. We could hear the noise of the traffic, I think it was only single glazing. The bathroom was adequate and clean but again, dated. The pool is freezing because it's "solar heated", which doesnt mean solar panel heated, just solar heated, sadly it is built in the shade apart from a few hours sun in the morning so that pool will never be warm. The blue paint has been eroded by the chemicals and comes off on your body! We told the staff and they closed the pool, yet another disappointment. I dont think it's great value for money as it wasnt THAT cheap and i wish we'd paid a few hundred more quid for a better experience. Gladly we were only there 4 nights. It wasnt awful but it wasnt great either. We ate breakfast at Alexandras opposite the park just a quick bus ride away. Another fab place to eat breakfast is past alexandras opposite the Shark Hotel at a place called K.K's they served delicious breakfasts including luxury muslis with homemade exotic yoghurts and fresh fruit as well as an abundance of baked goods for a fraction of what it costs to eat at the hotel. We also bought the week long orange travel pass that allows you to use the buses and the ferries as often as you wish. This worked out to be a great money saver, we certainly got our money's worth. I'd recommend forgetting about the explorer buses as they cost loads and just using the ordinary transport system on an orange saver card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: timsdm
Reviews.Content: A little bit tired looking but or room was at the end of a corridor so nice and quiet. We picked this hotel because they were in a good location for mardis gras and "relatively" inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: MN_Traveler320
Reviews.Content: The location is nice, on a major bus route easy access to downtown. The staff however is another issue. Most were not friendly at all. The night time staff would not even speak or acknowledge your presence. The reason you have to inter act with then is you need to be buzzed in, because of thier key system. Also one wonders about security as the same night staff seemed as if they would give you any any key you asked for. I would not stay on a return to Sydney, have found much nicer staff else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mundo303
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights in December and found the hotel to be excellent. The staff at reception were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. Paddington reminded me a little of Notting Hill, London, with plenty of cool bars and boutique shops. Personally I found staying out of the centre refreshing and thought I saw more of the 'real Sydney'. The best thing about the hotel was the free muffins and fruit provided every day at reception. The free DVD rental and Internet access was also a bonus. My only grumble would be that the swimming pool was freezing (though the weather wasn't great while we were there).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sullivans”
Reviews.Author: JoneHouston
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Sydney and surrounding area - very convenient to buses and great for walking - easy & quick access to town, ferries and Bondi and other southern beaches in the other direction. Very friendly and helpful staff. Appreciated the free internet access as well as the laundry facilities. Rooms were simple and clean - more than adequate for our use - we were not spending the day in the room while in Sydney. We appreciated the pool after a hot day of exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: metrobird
Reviews.Content: Very clean room with small but perfectly adequate ensuite shower room. The hotel has the advantage of having a small outdoor pool, being within walking distance of the city and being on the bus route to Bondi (30 min journey). The breakfast room is light and airy and a good selection is provided for AUS$14 per person. As well as internet access the hotel has a laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paddington”
Reviews.Author: Pollyjones
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Sullivans by Taxi from the airport charge $40 AUD. Taxi driver was very informative. We had arrived short of a suit case and a stolen cam corder but were determined not to let this deter from our holiday. The hotel staff were very helpful, allowing us into our room early. The room was not too large but we were only stopping a couple of nights. The reception staff were very helpful regarding our luggage and guided us to how to get the best of the short time we were in Sydney. I would definitely recommend position, quite a busy nightlife and plenty of boutique shops nearby. Just a short bus trip into the city and we had a couple of early morning strolls into centennial park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For The Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: ppg0270
Reviews.Content: Very centralized. Easy access to public transportation because the buses stop only a few step from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room”
Reviews.Author: crazybeavers
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location, free parking, very friendly reception staff who gave us lots of tips and advice on public transport and was very helpful with all questions we had. Cons: Our room (it was room 113, so you can avoid it) stank of urine; it got a little better once we activated ventilation and the air conditioner, but a/c is automatically switched off once you leave the room so it does not help much. The room was very small as well and it was not perfectly clean. There was rubbish left from a previous guest in the trash bin. There is free internet access from a computer in the lobby, but it was almost always occupied since there is only one for such a big hotel. For Sydney, it is however probably one of the hotels with reasonable prices. One last advice would be to avoid the airport shuttle which the hotel can book for you. When we were picked up, we were driven to another hotel and had to wait there for another vehicle for quite a time. It took much longer than we were told.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, simple, does the job”
Reviews.Author: PJBYYZ
Reviews.Content: For Sydney this is a great value. Well located but not smack downtown. You can walk to the Museum subway station in 10 minutes, but through interesting shops and the glbt neighbourhood which is always entertaining. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others. Tip: quicker route to subway or to Bondi Beach is to buy bus tickets at any of the numerous convenience stores around the city. Transit system is straightforward. Take the ferry from Circular Quay over to Manley (Leaves from Pier 3). Best views of Sydney Harbour

Reviews.Title: “Does the job!”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: It's on Oxford Street between Darlinghurst and Paddington - a great area to be so 10 out of 10 for location. Bus to city at the door OR just walk, its 25 mins downhill. Day time staff are fantastic however they have night staff who are kinda not engaged in their jobs. Maybe they hate it because it's night and they're tired I dunno, just VERY different service offerings. The good things are the location, free internet (wireless) and the feeling of security. Oxford Street has become quite "sketchy" and you have to watch out for yourself these days. Lots of drunk people on a Saturday night and more drunk "bums" than San Fran per sq metre I feel. The only think I have to give them feed back on re security is that they don't check your identity when you ask for a key. I walked in, asked for room 212 key and they gave it to me. Things I disliked about the hotel are : shower (it's a water consumption head) so you have to dance around to even get slightly wet. The rooms are a bit dated but still functional. Just a bit tired looking. I would stay here again for sure. It was $124 for a twin per night over a weekend so a great rate. The staff even booked our airport bus transfer and helped us with our bags. Give this place a chance, especially if you are not spending any great amount of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Unfussy”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while on business in Sydney. It's pretty basic but very comfortable. Room was OK and bed was comfortable. Nice internal courtyard & pool. It has laundry and internet facilities (get there early). No wireless access, however. Staff are friendly. Breakfast room is clean & food is OK. Located on a busy road which is near trendy Paddington area with great shops and restaurants - probably the best feature of this hotel. It is on a bus route which will take you directly into the City Centre (10 mins) or to Bondi (25 minutes). Would recommend Sullivans if you are on a budget and don't want to stay right in the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PopcornB
Reviews.Content: A wonderful location in Paddington - lots of interesting shops, next door to a new/2nd hand bookshop that stays open until midnight. Just outside is a bus stop with frequent buses to Circular Quay and Bondi Beach, and several places to eat, a 7-11 etc. Friendly staff, let us into our room early (10am), clean, comfortable room with a mini-fridge and a safe. It wasn't the weather for the pool, but it looked great. Free internet access from the terminal in reception and a useful laundry room. Excellent value for money for Sydney - a short walk from the Saturday Paddington market.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: L16gsy
Reviews.Content: Booked with the hotel directly after reading reviews. They communicated effectively through emails. We decided on the hotel not knowing anything about Sydney and found it to be good value for money. We walked to the CBD a couple of times and caught the bus which was cheap and regular other times. Not much going on locally but the CBD is very close. Initial room was on the main road and found it to be very noisy, but was quickly changed to a room at the back which was very quiet. Good internet access avaiable which is free. Rooms serviced daily and they wait if you are having a lay in. Reception staff are helpful and polite. We did all the usual things whilst in Sydney, Bridge walk, Sky Tower, Bondi & Manly beaches, Blue Mountains, Hunter Valley - all very worth while and interesting and the 5 of us had a great time. Would recomment this hotel for anyone looking for value for money and pleasant service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches”
Reviews.Author: iha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value for money for Sydney. Great location, nice little (outdoor) swimming pool and friendly helpful staff. Nice to have free movies, free internet, good insiders local info guide in room. Only gripe is that room was not cleaned so thoroughly 1 day (we stayed 4), but would nonetheless highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: nickSydney
Reviews.Content: Pros -Good location -Fairly clean -Cheap -Free internet -Free parking Cons -Cleaner ate half of a Krispy Kreme Donut in room (really!!!) -A little dated in decor -Some of the staff were a little grumpy -We were given the keys to a room with someone else already in there! -Limited parking

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the best place we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Keith_and_Candice
Reviews.Content: Initial disappointment when we were given keys to a room that stank of smoke but were given another room as soon as we informed them of this. Very helpful staff. Great location. Easy to walk into city and SCG. Lots of good restaurants around. Limited facilities in room but functional. Pool nice especially in morning when sun was on it. Handy free underground carparking as restricted parking outside.

HotelInfo.Name: Arts Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 21 Oxford Street | Paddington, Sydney, New South Wales 2021, Australia
